jam
Interface FrontEndCommunication

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.EventListener, java.util.Observer, java.util.prefs.PreferenceChangeListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
VMECommunication
public interface FrontEndCommunication
extends java.util.Observer, java.util.prefs.PreferenceChangeListener

Interface that generalizes to network communicate with a front end using udp packets Two udp sockets can be setup with a daemon that receives packets and knows what to do with them The first int of a packet indicates what type of packe it is.

Since:
JDK1.1
Version:
0.5 August 2000
Author:
Ken Swartz

Method Detail

setup

public void setup()
           throws JamException
Setup up the networking to the Front End. Called when Online data taking is setup.

Throws:
JamException - when something goes wrong

update

public void update(java.util.Observable observable,
                   java.lang.Object o)
Reciever of distributed events can listen for broadcasted event Implementation of Observable interface

Specified by:
update in interface java.util.Observer
Parameters:
observable - source of observed event
o - communicated message

startAcquisition

public void startAcquisition()
Tell the Front End to start acquistion.

stopAcquisition

public void stopAcquisition()
Tell the Front End to stop acquisiton, should also flushes out existing data in the front end.

end

public void end()
Tell the Front End to end a run. should also flush out existing data in the front end and put a end of run marker at its end of the last buffer.

flush

public void flush()
Tell the Front End to fluss out the data buffer

readScalers

public void readScalers()
Tell the VME to read the scalers send back to packets the packet with the scaler values and a packet if read OK or ERROR and message

clearScalers

public void clearScalers()
Tell the Front to clear the scalers sends a reply if OK or ERROR

readCounters

public void readCounters()
Tell the Front to read the counters send back to packets the packet with the counter values and a packet if read OK or ERROR and message

zeroCounters

public void zeroCounters()
Tell the Font to zero the counters Front end should a reply with a OK or ERROR

verbose

public void verbose(boolean state)
Tells the Front End to reply with verbose status messages, which can be output for the user to see.

Parameters:
state - TRUE to set the front end in verbose mode

debug

public void debug(boolean state)
Tells the Front End that we want it to put it to debug mode.

Parameters:
state - TRUE to set the front end in debug mode

setupCamac

public void setupCamac(CamacCommands camacCommands)
                throws JamException
New version uploads CAMAC CNAF commands with udp pakets, and sets up the camac crate.

Parameters:
camacCommands - object containing CAMAC CNAF commands
Throws:
JamException - if there is a problem setting up

                  throws JamException
Throws:
JamException

sendScalerInterval

public void sendScalerInterval(int milliseconds)
                        throws JamException
Throws:
JamException

run

public void run()
Method that is a deamon for receiving packets from the Front End. The first int of the packet is the status word it determines how the packet is to be handled
